content.description: Go up through some crumbly rock for the first bolts to a ledge. Then do a harder step up to a pleasant, steep headwall. Thanks to whoever bolted it, it is a good addition.
content.location: Continue past the Punchbowl for a cliffband or two, keep an eye out for plaques.

content.description:
This fantastic route is one of the best at Lime Creek for the grade. The late Logan Jauernigg had the vision for this spectacular line, and it is a true area classic. The route was originally called "The Gift"; however, the community decided to rename this amazing line "Logan's Gift" in memory of the visionary young man who lost his life adventuring at far too young of an age. The route was plagued with a misplaced bolt, some microwave-sized death blocks, and a crux hold that needed reenforcing. After searching for Logan to discuss and consulting the community, I have updated this route so that it may shine in its full glory as one of Colorado's great 5.13s. Enjoy!

BETA:

3 no-hands rests, plenty of bouldering, a mantel, a dyno, slab, face, overhang, a heartbreaker crux at the end, an easy finish... THIS ROUTE HAS IT ALL!
content.location: This is the penultimate route on the Punchbowl side, furthest from the parking.

content.description: Climb 3 bolts of slab to a seam where the angle kicks back. Pull through a boulder problem, then try not to pump out climbing through the rest of the white streak. Have a rest on the ledge, and prepare for 2 more bolts of tricky dihedral to the anchors. The upper dihedral shares a few holds with the route to the right around the last bolt.
content.location:
Look for a white streak left of

The Changeling

.

content.description: Start with a low-angled scramble to the 2nd bolt, then climb through some crumbly bands to a crux at the mini-roof.
content.location: This is the far left route at the Secret Stash. A small rock plaque at the base identifies it.

content.description: Not much is known about this route.
content.location: It is the last route on the wall.

content.description: Fairly steep climbing on the lower section with good holds spaced leads to the upper technical headwall after a sit down rest sets you up for the hard to read ending. Keep it together for a good onsight. This is fairly easy for the grade.
content.location: This is to the right of Jeti Slipstream and to the left of The Gift.
